title: My $1,000+/m Keyword Research SECRETS for Amazon KDP (Zero Cost Strategy!)

tactics.name: demand-first niche selection
tactics.description: Prioritize niches with existing demand by analyzing competitor presence and search volume
steps: Identify locations with high restaurant competition (e.g., Nottingham vs London)
Assess keyword search volume without software
source_quotes: There's no point in publishing a book inside a niche where there's no demand

tactics.name: Amazon Autocomplete Keyword Research
tactics.description: Use Amazon's autocomplete feature to discover high-demand keywords without paid tools.
steps: Search all departments on Amazon using incognito mode
Input main keyword (niche/sub-niche) into search bar
Capture autocomplete suggestions as keyword opportunities
caveats: Autocomplete results may include irrelevant keywords
source_quotes: you need Amazon so if you want to figure out the demand of a keyword what are you supposed to do if you don't need these softwares obviously you need Amazon

tactics.name: autocomplete_keyword_research
tactics.description: Leverage Amazon's autocomplete feature to identify high-demand keywords by observing repeated search patterns from shoppers.
steps: Search main keywords in Amazon's autocomplete to find related terms
Prioritize keywords that appear in autocomplete as they indicate demand
Include validated keywords in backend keywords and product description
caveats: Keywords not appearing in autocomplete may indicate low demand
source_quotes: if the search term or your sub niche and niche are not popping up in your auto complete there's no demand

tactics.name: Keyword Targeting Without Software
tactics.description: Use Amazon auto-complete keywords and SEO to index for demand without paid tools
steps: Group keywords into 2 campaigns (fixed bids + broad match)
Launch with fixed bids first, then expand to broad match
caveats: Requires quality book in profitable niche
source_quotes: you don't need software you can do it all by yourself if you have the skill

heuristics.name: review count threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niche
source_quotes: You might be using software to see if there's demand for certain keywords

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize keywords
source_quotes: if you find a keyword and there's 100 searches per month great you get to show your book in front of 100 people

heuristics.name: autocomplete_demand_signal
heuristics.condition: If a keyword does not appear in Amazon's autocomplete, it likely has low demand
source_quotes: if I search Down syndrome and I want to make a cookbook about Down syndrome and I type in Down syndrome but then cookbook doesn't show up anywhere on the ortho

claims.statement: KDP authors can achieve $1,000+ monthly profit without keyword research software
source_quotes: This book makes me a grand a month in net profit without any softwares

claims.statement: Amazon autocomplete provides actionable keyword data for free
source_quotes: guess what the autocomplete does if I give the autocomplete the word Chinese cookbook guess what it's going to do

claims.statement: Amazon's autocomplete feature provides direct insight into consumer search demand without requiring third-party tools
source_quotes: straight from Amazon no software needed

claims.statement: Amazon ads can be profitable with 10-15 keywords in fixed bids
source_quotes: my aost is 25% my ads are profitable

niche_patterns.description: Combine specific audience identities with pain points and unique constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates hyper-targeted niches with unmet needs
source_quotes: You're trying to find a niche with demand
